intro: Pluchea longiseta, commonly known as the long-hair daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Pluchea longiseta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
